page.title: 08Kelso Traffic Survey
page.content: For an hour one{Friday in June 1985}we did a vehicle survey on a street leading off the square; we counted {1274 vehicles - 1105 cars, 70 lorries, {88 vans}and{11 bicycles.}This amount of traffic often leads to{congestion } and many local people feel the need for{traffic lights,}pedestrian crossings, more car{parking space}and a{new bridge.}Presently, the most popular cars are{Vauxhall. Blue and {red}are the most common colours and{ {75% }of vehicles have the local registrations{KS}or{SH. 43%}were less than 3 years old.{69%}were saloons,{ {19%}were hatchbacks and{12%}were estates. We counted{71%}male and{29%} female drivers - {47%}were over the{ {30mph limit}coming down into the town. Finally most people now follow the recent seat belt law -{92%}were wearing and only{8%}had forgotten.
